author: kfogel
msg: Is it "out-of-date" or "out of date"?
Here's looking at you, Brane...
Fowler had nothing to say.  Looking for guidance, I turned to the
Internet.  Surprisingly, search://"out-of-date or out of date"/ is an
extreme SIP, returning only one result.  (Though after this commit
hits the Net, the search indexes won't stay you-know-what for long.)
The one hit is http://www.salisbury.gov.uk/style-guide.pdf, which
recommends:
Hyphenate to avoid confusion or when using 'out-of-date' as an
adjective: "This policy is now out of date", "We must do something
about that out-of-date policy"
That's more or less what I wanted to do anyway, albeit eschewing the
letter of the rule for its finer, subtler spirit: use "out-of-date"
whenever the phrase appears in an adjectival position (though it may
formally be a noun or an adjective) and is not the predicate of a
copula; use "out of date" in all other cases.
Why do I care?  Because r27365 / issue #2740 made me crazy.

author: kfogel
msg: Fix issue #2740: make out-of-date errors more consistent and less terrifying.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/version.c
(dav_svn__checkout): Distinguish between out-of-date errors and
newer-than-txn errors; give each a simpler message.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_neon/commit.c
(checkout_resource): Clarify out-of-date message.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/commit.c
(out_of_date): Take new 'kind' parameter, use it to make a better
message.  Lose the txn information; it only distracted users.
(delete_entry, add_directory, add_file, open_file, change_dir_prop):
Pass new 'kind' parameter to out_of_date.
Due to issue #2993, I was unable to test this portion of the change:
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/commit.c
(relative_dir_path, relative_file_path): New helper functions.
(checkout_dir, checkout_file): Clarify out-of-date message, and give
the full relative path to the item.

author: glasser
msg: On the 'issue-2986-work' branch, merge 27353:27362 from trunk.
(Using "svn merge".  Merge tracking.  Against a 1.4.x server.  Will
wonders never cease?)

author: glasser
msg: This issue is hopefully completed; patch with log message will
hit mailing list shortly for review.

author: kfogel
msg: Wrap or rename functions and vtable entries named 'open', to prevent
macro expansion with new versions of glibc.  See Joe Orton's mail
about this: http://svn.haxx.se/dev/archive-2007-09/0343.shtml.
Patch by: joe
me
* subversion/libsvn_ra/ra_loader.h
(svn_ra__vtable_t.open_session): Was 'open'.  All callers changed.
* subversion/libsvn_fs/fs-loader.h
(fs_library_vtable_t.open_fs, fs_library_vtable_t.open_fs_for_recovery):
Were 'open' and 'open_for_recovery', respectively.  All callers changed.
* build/generator/swig/header_wrappers.py
(Generator._write_callbacks): Wrap generated callback function name
invocation in parentheses.
* everywhere else: Wrap 'open' calls in parentheses.
